message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest hypoglycemia and the fact that symptoms are relieved after drinking orange juice further suggests hypoglycemia. Insulin lower blood sugar, so lowering insulin dose before exercise, which can further lower blood sugar, is important. All other options do not necessarily increase the risk of hypoglycemia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest hypoglycemia and the fact that drinking orange juice resolves them further confirms it. Exercise can cause the patient's blood glucose levels to rapidly decrease, so the most important situation to lower insulin dose would be before exercise.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest hypoglycemia and drinking orange juice suggests that her symptoms are relieved by glucose. Since exercise can lower blood glucose levels, it is most important to lower insulin dose before exercise to prevent hypoglycemia. Large meals and viral infections can also affect blood glucose levels, but exercise is the most significant contributor to hypoglycemia in this case.

Therefore, it is most important to lower the insulin dose before exercise to avoid hypoglycemia. All other options are not specifically related to hypoglycemia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest hypoglycemia, and since they occur during the day and resolve after drinking orange juice, it is likely that the patient is experiencing exercise-induced hypoglycemia. Therefore, lowering her insulin dose before exercise is the most important situation to consider.

Exercise can lower blood glucose levels, so it is important to lower insulin dose before exercise to prevent hypoglycemia. Viral infection and stressful exam may cause stress-induced hyperglycemia, and large meals may require an increase in insulin dose.
